attributes.action: Add my founded school subject into the UK school curriculum from ages 11 above
attributes.additional_details:
Students will gain a better understanding of how and why topics link in they way they do, this can be from methods and strategies from the subject Topic Linking, enabling secondary school students to build a more comprehensive approach to the English language. 

From your help, we can add this to the curriculum and teach it to secondary students, and above. We can confirm what resources we need to support students in the subject.
attributes.background: We would like to introduce the subject Topic Linking from secondary years in the UK until University. This can be a A-level course and a degree course and even career job opportunities. I would like to make this a subject that can be taught in every secondary and above schools.

rejection.details:
Petitions need to call on the Government or Parliament to take a specific action.

We're not sure exactly what you mean by "Topic Linking", and it's therefore not clear to us what new subject you want to be introduced.

You could start a new petition explaining clearly what you would like the Government or Parliament to do.
